neighborhoods.name: Duomo & Centro Storico
neighborhoods.character: The historic heart of Florence containing the highest concentration of Renaissance architecture and museums in the world.

location.description: The central district of Florence encompassing the Duomo and many major historical sites.

history.overview: Centro Storico represents the ancient core of Florence with over 2,000 years of history, including its golden age as the birthplace of the Renaissance.
history.significance: This district contains the highest concentration of Renaissance art and architecture in the world, serving as the center of European culture during the 14th-16th centuries.
notable_events: Rule of the Medici family (15th-18th centuries)
Recognition as a UNESCO World Heritage site (1982)

practical_info.safety: Generally safe but watch for pickpockets in crowded tourist areas.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Early morning or evening to avoid crowds, especially in high season.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with primarily pedestrian-only zones.

attractions.name: Florence Cathedral (Duomo)
attractions.description: Iconic cathedral with Brunelleschi's revolutionary dome and Giotto's bell tower.
attractions.appeal: Marvel at Renaissance engineering and climb the dome for panoramic city views.

attractions.name: Uffizi Gallery
attractions.description: World-renowned art museum housing the greatest collection of Renaissance masterpieces.
attractions.appeal: See works by Botticelli, Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Raphael in one spectacular building.

attractions.name: Piazza della Signoria
attractions.description: Historic central square serving as Florence's political heart for centuries.
attractions.appeal: Experience an open-air sculpture gallery including a replica of Michelangelo's David.

dining.name: All'Antico Vinaio
dining.known_for: World-famous sandwiches with high-quality Tuscan ingredients
dining.atmosphere: Busy takeaway with lines around the block.

dining.name: Trattoria Sostanza
dining.known_for: Butter chicken and bistecca alla fiorentina
dining.atmosphere: Authentic, unchanged for nearly a century.

dining.name: La Giostra
dining.atmosphere: Intimate, candlelit restaurant with celebrity photos.

activities.name: Renaissance Art Walking Tour
activities.description: Guided exploration of Florence's artistic masterpieces and their historical context.

activities.name: Palazzo Vecchio Secret Passages Tour
activities.description: Behind-the-scenes exploration of hidden corridors in Florence's medieval town hall.

stay_here_if: You want to be within walking distance of major attractions.
You're a first-time visitor to Florence.
You don't mind tourist crowds and higher prices.
avoid_if: You're sensitive to crowds and noise.
You prefer more authentic local experiences.
insider_tips: Visit major sites at opening time (8:15 am) to avoid tour groups.
Book museum tickets online at least a week in advance, especially for the Uffizi and Accademia.
Try aperitivo at cafes in lesser-known piazzas rather than the main squares.

neighborhoods.name: Oltrarno
neighborhoods.character: Authentic, artistic neighborhood across the Arno river, known for artisan workshops, bohemian atmosphere, and less touristy vibe.

location.description: Located on the south bank of the Arno River, directly across from the historic center.

history.overview: Historically the artisan quarter where craftspeople produced goods for noble Florentine families.
history.significance: Maintains the authentic character of old Florence with continuing traditions of craftsmanship.
notable_events: Development as workshop district in Medieval and Renaissance periods
Construction of Palazzo Pitti as Medici residence (16th century)
Spared from destruction during WWII unlike areas around the other bridges

transit: Walking distance to center via historic bridges
practical_info.safety: Generally safe, even at night in most areas.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Afternoons for workshops, evenings for dining atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable but involves some hills and narrow streets.

attractions.name: Palazzo Pitti
attractions.description: Massive Renaissance palace housing several museums with art, costumes, and royal apartments.
attractions.appeal: Experience the grandeur of Medici living and explore less crowded but equally impressive art collections.

attractions.name: Piazza Santo Spirito
attractions.description: Lively square centered around the Basilica of Santo Spirito designed by Brunelleschi.
attractions.appeal: Experience authentic Florentine life with locals enjoying cafes, markets, and evening gatherings.

attractions.name: Boboli Gardens
attractions.description: Elaborate Italian garden behind Palazzo Pitti with sculptures, fountains, and panoramic views.
attractions.appeal: Escape the city crowds in one of Italy's most important historic gardens.

dining.name: Gustapizza
dining.atmosphere: Tiny, popular pizzeria with locals and tourists alike.

activities.name: Artisan Workshop Tours
activities.description: Visit leather workers, goldsmiths, bookbinders, and other traditional craftspeople.

activities.name: Bardini Gardens Visit
activities.description: Less-known historic garden with spectacular views of Florence.

stay_here_if: You want authentic Florentine atmosphere with great dining options.
You prefer to be close to attractions but away from the worst crowds.
You're interested in artisanal crafts and local culture.
avoid_if: You want to minimize walking to major attractions.
You require completely flat terrain (some streets are hilly).
insider_tips: Visit the Oltrarno workshops in the afternoon when artisans are more likely to be working.
Shop at the daily market in Piazza Santo Spirito for picnic supplies and local products.
Many restaurants require reservations, especially Thursday through Saturday.

neighborhoods.name: Santa Croce
neighborhoods.character: Authentic, lively neighborhood blending historic significance with local Florentine life, markets, and nightlife.

location.description: Located east of the Duomo, extending to the eastern edge of the historic center.

history.overview: Historic district centered around the Franciscan Basilica of Santa Croce, with a rich mixture of medieval and Renaissance heritage.
history.significance: Home to the largest Franciscan church in the world and the burial place of many Italian luminaries including Michelangelo, Galileo, and Machiavelli.
notable_events: Historic floods of 1966 which severely damaged the area
Development as a center for leather craftsmanship

transit: Taxi stands at Piazza Santa Croce
practical_info.safety: Generally safe but be aware of pickpockets in crowded areas.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for markets, afternoon for churches, evening for nightlife.
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with mostly flat terrain.

attractions.name: Basilica di Santa Croce
attractions.description: Magnificent Gothic church containing tombs of Michelangelo, Galileo, and Machiavelli as well as frescoes by Giotto.
attractions.appeal: Experience one of Florence's most historic churches with fewer crowds than the Duomo.

attractions.name: Mercato di Sant'Ambrogio
attractions.description: Authentic local market selling fresh produce, meats, cheeses, and other Tuscan specialties.
attractions.appeal: Experience real Florentine food shopping alongside locals.

attractions.name: Scuola del Cuoio
attractions.description: Historic leather school and workshop located within the Santa Croce complex.
attractions.appeal: Watch artisans create traditional leather goods and purchase quality souvenirs directly from makers.

dining.name: Cibrèo Trattoria
dining.known_for: Traditional Tuscan dishes with no pasta on the menu
dining.atmosphere: Historic and elegant without being stuffy.

dining.name: Semel
dining.known_for: Creative gourmet sandwiches in tiny shop
dining.atmosphere: Standing room only, authentic local experience.

activities.name: Food and Market Tour
activities.description: Guided exploration of Sant'Ambrogio market with tastings of local specialties.

activities.name: Leather Workshop Experience
activities.description: Hands-on workshop learning traditional Florentine leather crafting techniques.

stay_here_if: You want authentic Florentine atmosphere with great food options.
You enjoy nightlife and don't mind some evening noise.
You want to be within walking distance of major sights but in a more local area.
avoid_if: You require absolute quiet at night.
You're uncomfortable in areas with a mix of tourists and locals.
insider_tips: Visit Sant'Ambrogio market early in the morning for the best selection and authentic atmosphere.
The area around Via de' Macci and Via Pietrapiana has excellent local restaurants away from tourist crowds.
Check out the calcio storico (historic football) matches in Piazza Santa Croce if visiting in June.

neighborhoods.name: San Niccolò
neighborhoods.character: Charming, village-like neighborhood at the base of the hillside with artisan workshops, local restaurants, and scenic views.

location.description: Located along the south bank of the Arno at the eastern edge of Oltrarno, at the foot of the hills.

history.overview: Former village outside the city walls that maintained its distinctive character even after incorporation into Florence.
history.significance: Important gateway to Florence from the south, with the ancient tower of Porta San Niccolò marking the entrance.
notable_events: Construction of medieval city walls and gate (13th century)
Contemporary revival as an artistic district

transit: Walking connection to center via Ponte alle Grazie
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Late afternoon through sunset for the best views and atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Walkable but involves uphill sections to reach viewpoints.

attractions.name: Piazzale Michelangelo
attractions.description: Famous panoramic terrace offering spectacular views of Florence's skyline.
attractions.appeal: Capture postcard-perfect photos of Florence, especially at sunset.

attractions.name: San Miniato al Monte
attractions.description: Beautiful Romanesque church sitting above Piazzale Michelangelo with even better views.
attractions.appeal: Experience one of Florence's most beautiful churches with magnificent mosaics and panoramas.

attractions.name: Porta San Niccolò
attractions.description: The tallest of Florence's surviving medieval gates, dating from the 13th century.
attractions.appeal: Climb the tower in summer months for unique views of the city.

dining.name: Zeb
dining.known_for: Modern takes on Tuscan classics, especially pasta

activities.name: Sunset Photography
activities.description: Capture Florence's skyline bathed in golden light from multiple viewpoints.

activities.name: Rose Garden Visit
activities.description: Explore the free public garden with roses, sculptures, and city views.

stay_here_if: You want a quiet, authentic neighborhood with excellent views.
You don't mind walking uphill or taking buses.
You prefer a more residential atmosphere.
avoid_if: You want to be in the center of the action.
You have mobility issues (area involves hills).
insider_tips: Skip the crowds at Piazzale Michelangelo and walk 10 minutes further uphill to San Miniato for even better views.
The Rose Garden and Iris Garden (seasonal) offer free alternatives to Piazzale Michelangelo with fewer tourists.
Summer evenings bring pop-up bars and events to the riverbank near Porta San Niccolò.

neighborhoods.name: San Lorenzo & San Marco
neighborhoods.character: Bustling, market-focused district with Medici heritage, street vendors, and authentic Florentine energy.

location.description: Located north of the Duomo, containing the central market and major Medici monuments.

history.overview: The Medici family's district containing their parish church (San Lorenzo) and important family monuments.
history.significance: Economic center of Florence with the city's main market tradition dating back centuries.
notable_events: Construction of San Lorenzo basilica under Medici patronage
Michelangelo's work on the Medici Chapels (1520s)
Building of the 19th century iron and glass market structure

transit: 10-minute walk from Santa Maria Novella train station
practical_info.safety: Generally safe but watch for pickpockets around the market area.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for market shopping, afternoon for cultural sites.

attractions.name: Mercato Centrale
attractions.description: Two-level market with traditional food vendors downstairs and gourmet food court upstairs.
attractions.appeal: Experience Florence's food culture all in one place with options for every budget.

attractions.name: Basilica di San Lorenzo
attractions.description: The Medici family's parish church designed by Brunelleschi with works by Donatello.
attractions.appeal: Experience a key Renaissance building without the crowds of the Duomo.

attractions.name: Medici Chapels
attractions.description: Ornate mausoleum of the Medici family featuring Michelangelo's sculptures and architecture.
attractions.appeal: See some of Michelangelo's finest sculptural work in an intimate setting.

dining.name: Trattoria Mario
dining.known_for: Bistecca alla fiorentina and daily specials
dining.atmosphere: Crowded, family-run lunch spot with shared tables.

dining.name: Mercato Centrale Food Court
dining.known_for: Variety of high-quality Tuscan and Italian options

dining.name: Il Cernacchino
dining.known_for: Traditional Florentine sandwiches with boiled beef
dining.atmosphere: Tiny shop with locals and tourists alike.

activities.name: Market Shopping and Tasting
activities.description: Explore both the traditional market and surrounding leather market stalls.

activities.name: Medici History Tour
activities.description: Follow the legacy of Florence's most powerful family through their monuments.

stay_here_if: You want central location with vibrant market atmosphere.
Shopping and food are priorities for your visit.
You want to be close to the train station.
insider_tips: The ground floor of Mercato Centrale closes by 2pm, while the upper floor remains open until midnight.
Visit Trattoria Mario for lunch before 1pm to avoid long waits (closed for dinner).
Explore the Mercato di Sant'Ambrogio for a more local, less touristy market experience not far away.
